document_title: Mitral valve stenosis: Causes, signs, complications and prevention
subsection_content:
The heart is the center of the circulatory system, consisting of 4 chambers, 2 upper chambers (atrial chambers) are used to receive blood, 2 lower heart chambers (ventricular chambers) are used to pump blood.
The heart valve system includes: mitral valve, tricuspid valve, aortic valve and pulmonary valve, which open and close so that blood flows only in one direction in the heart.
The mitral valve opens when blood flows from the left atrium to the left ventricle, the valve leaflets close to prevent blood flow back to the left atrium. When the mitral valve is damaged, the function of closing or opening is completely affected.
